      LexicalFeatures(TextContainer tc)

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Concrete Methods Deprecated Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      double avgSyllablesPerSentence()
      Calculates the average number of syllables per sentence.
      double avgWordFrequencyClass()
      Calculates Average Word Frequency Class
      Formula:
      "Let C be a text corpus, and let |C| be the number of words in C.
      Moreover, let f(w) denote the frequency of a word w âˆˆ C, and let r(w)
      denote the rank of w in a word list of C, which is sorted by decreasing
      frequency.
      double avgWordLength()
      Calculates the average word length.
      Formula:
      a = sum of all word lenghts
      b = textlength in words
      a / b
      double avgWordsPerSentence()
      Calculates the average number of words per sentence
      Formula:
      a = textlength in words
      b = textlength in sentences
      a / b
      double brunetMeasure()
      Deprecated. 
      This Feature is implemented as in Literature said
      but with texts longer then 15 words the result will be infinity
      java.util.Map<java.util.ArrayList<java.lang.String>,java.lang.Double> charsNGrams(boolean normalized, int nGram) 
      double compressionRate()
      Measures the Compression Rate(1.0 = 100%) Compression Tool = "ZIP" with Level 9 (Highest)
      NOT WORKING CORRECTLY WITH A STRING ENTERED.
      WORKS FINE WITH A FILEPATH.
      double compressionTime(int rounds)
      Calculates the compression in MegaBytes/Sec
      double daleChallIndex()
      Calculates Dale-Chall Index
      Formula:
      Raw Score = 0.1579 * (PDW) + 0.0496 * ASL
      Raw Score = Reading Grade of a reader who can comprehend your text at 3rd
      grade or below.
      PDW = Percentage of Difficult Words(Words not in List(3000 words))
      ASL = Average Sentence Length in words
      If (PDW) is greater than 5%, then:
      Adjusted Score = Raw Score + 3.6365, otherwise Adjusted Score = Raw
      Score
      double fleschKincaidGrade()
      Calculates Flesch-Kincaid Grade
      Syllable Count realized with
      https:// github.com/troywatson/Lawrence-Style-Checker
      Formula:
      W = text length in words
      S = text length in sentences
      T= total syllables in text
      206.835-1.015(W/S)-84.6(T/W)
      java.util.Map<java.lang.String,java.lang.Double> frequencyOfChars(boolean normalized, boolean allLowerCase)
      Counts the frequency of all characters in the text, including white spaces and special chars
      java.util.Map<java.lang.String,java.lang.Double> frequencyOfSpecialChars(boolean normalized)
      Counts the frequency of all special characters in the text.
      java.util.Map<java.lang.String,java.lang.Double> frequencyOfWords(boolean normalized)
      Counts the frequency of all words in the text.(Words are transformed into lower case).
      double gunningFogIndex()
      Calculates Gunning-Fog Index
      Syllable Count realized with
      https:// github.com/troywatson/Lawrence-Style-Checker
      Formula:
      W = text length in words
      S = text length in sentences
      C=Complex words(3 or more syllables)
      0.4((W/S)+100(C/W))
      double honoreMeasure()
      Calculates Honore's Measure
      Formula:
      N = text length in words
      V = number of different words in text
      V1 = number of hapax legomena(occur once)
      100*log(N/(1-(V1/V)))
      double indexOfDiversity()
      Calculates the index of diversity, that is the proportion of hapax legomena and the text lenght in words
      Formula:
      a = frequency of hapax legomena
      b = textlength in words
      a / b
      double numberOfHapaxDislegomena()
      Calculates the number of Hapax Dislegomena in the text(words which occur exactly two times)
      double numberOfHapaxLegomena()
      Calculates the number of Hapax legomena in the text(words which occur exactly one time)
      double sichelMeasure()
      Calculates Sichel's Measure
      Formula:
      V = number of different words in text
      V2 = number of hapax dislegomena(occur twice)
      V2/V
      double typeTokenRatio()
      Calculates Type-Token Ratio
      Formula:
      Token = text length in words
      Type = number of different words
      result = Type/Token
      java.util.Map<java.util.ArrayList<java.lang.String>,java.lang.Double> wordNGrams(boolean normalized, int nGram) 
      double yuleKMeasure()
      Calculates Yule's K Measure
      Formula:
      N = number of different words in text
      Entry --> String = words , Double = how often it occurs in text M =sum of (all "Doubles"(from Entry)^2)
      1000((M-N)/N^2)

    • Method Detail

      • frequencyOfChars

        public java.util.Map<java.lang.String,java.lang.Double> frequencyOfChars(boolean normalized,
                                                                         boolean allLowerCase)
        Counts the frequency of all characters in the text, including white spaces and special chars
        Parameters:
        normalized - = true - will return the frequency of the characters proportional to 100%( 1.0 = 100%).
        = false - returns raw values;
        allLowerCase - = true - all characters will be transformed into lower case.
        Returns:
        a sorted map with all characters(K) and their frequency(V).

      • frequencyOfSpecialChars

        public java.util.Map<java.lang.String,java.lang.Double> frequencyOfSpecialChars(boolean normalized)
        Counts the frequency of all special characters in the text.
        Parameters:
        normalized - = true - will return the frequency of the characters proportional to 100%( 1.0 = 100%).
        = false - returns raw values;
        Returns:
        a sorted map with all special characters(K) and their frequency(V).

      • frequencyOfWords

        public java.util.Map<java.lang.String,java.lang.Double> frequencyOfWords(boolean normalized)
        Counts the frequency of all words in the text.(Words are transformed into lower case).
        Parameters:
        normalized - = true - will return the frequency of the words proportional to 100%( 1.0 = 100%).
        = false - returns raw values;
        Returns:
        a sorted map with all words(K) and their frequency(V)

      • avgWordLength

        public double avgWordLength()
        Calculates the average word length.
        Formula:
        a = sum of all word lenghts
        b = textlength in words
        a / b
        Returns:
        the average word length

      • avgWordsPerSentence

        public double avgWordsPerSentence()
        Calculates the average number of words per sentence
        Formula:
        a = textlength in words
        b = textlength in sentences
        a / b
        Returns:
        average number of words per sentence

      • avgSyllablesPerSentence

        public double avgSyllablesPerSentence()
        Calculates the average number of syllables per sentence.
        Formula:
        a = number of syllables in text
        b = textlength in sentences
        a / b         Syllable Count realized with https:// github.com/troywatson/Lawrence-Style-Checker
        Returns:
        average number of syllables per sentence

      • wordNGrams

        public java.util.Map<java.util.ArrayList<java.lang.String>,java.lang.Double> wordNGrams(boolean normalized,
                                                                                        int nGram)
        Parameters:
        normalized - = true - will return the frequency of the words proportional to 100%( 1.0 = 100%).
        = false - returns raw values;
        nGram - - length of the N Grams (must be >= 2)
        Returns:
        a sorted map with all n-grams of words(K) and their quantity(V)
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if nGram < 2

      • charsNGrams

        public java.util.Map<java.util.ArrayList<java.lang.String>,java.lang.Double> charsNGrams(boolean normalized,
                                                                                         int nGram)
        Parameters:
        normalized - = true - will return the frequency of the words proportional to 100%( 1.0 = 100%).
        = false - returns raw values;
        nGram - - length of the N Grams (must be >= 2)
        Returns:
        a sorted map with all n-grams of characters(K) and their quantity(V)
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if nGram < 2

      • numberOfHapaxLegomena

        public double numberOfHapaxLegomena()
        Calculates the number of Hapax legomena in the text(words which occur exactly one time)
        Returns:
        Number of Hapax Legomena in Text

      • numberOfHapaxDislegomena

        public double numberOfHapaxDislegomena()
        Calculates the number of Hapax Dislegomena in the text(words which occur exactly two times)
        Returns:
        Number of Hapax Dislegomena in Text

      • indexOfDiversity

        public double indexOfDiversity()
        Calculates the index of diversity, that is the proportion of hapax legomena and the text lenght in words
        Formula:
        a = frequency of hapax legomena
        b = textlength in words
        a / b

      • honoreMeasure

        public double honoreMeasure()
        Calculates Honore's Measure
        Formula:
        N = text length in words
        V = number of different words in text
        V1 = number of hapax legomena(occur once)
        100*log(N/(1-(V1/V)))
        Returns:
        Honore's Measure
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if V == V1 (happens when text is very short)

      • sichelMeasure

        public double sichelMeasure()
        Calculates Sichel's Measure
        Formula:
        V = number of different words in text
        V2 = number of hapax dislegomena(occur twice)
        V2/V
        Returns:
        Honore's Measure
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if V == 0(Text empty or all words in text the same)

      • brunetMeasure

        public double brunetMeasure()
        Deprecated. This Feature is implemented as in Literature said
        but with texts longer then 15 words the result will be infinity

      • fleschKincaidGrade

        public double fleschKincaidGrade()
        Calculates Flesch-Kincaid Grade
        Syllable Count realized with
        https:// github.com/troywatson/Lawrence-Style-Checker
        Formula:
        W = text length in words
        S = text length in sentences
        T= total syllables in text
        206.835-1.015(W/S)-84.6(T/W)
        Returns:
        Flesch-Kincaid Grade

      • gunningFogIndex

        public double gunningFogIndex()
        Calculates Gunning-Fog Index
        Syllable Count realized with
        https:// github.com/troywatson/Lawrence-Style-Checker
        Formula:
        W = text length in words
        S = text length in sentences
        C=Complex words(3 or more syllables)
        0.4((W/S)+100(C/W))
        Returns:
        Gunning-Fog Index

      • yuleKMeasure

        public double yuleKMeasure()
        Calculates Yule's K Measure
        Formula:
        N = number of different words in text
        Entry --> String = words , Double = how often it occurs in text M =sum of (all "Doubles"(from Entry)^2)
        1000((M-N)/N^2)
        Returns:
        Yule's K Measure
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - - Result will be 0, as M and N are equal. Probably text is too short.

      • daleChallIndex

        public double daleChallIndex()
        Calculates Dale-Chall Index
        Formula:
        Raw Score = 0.1579 * (PDW) + 0.0496 * ASL
        Raw Score = Reading Grade of a reader who can comprehend your text at 3rd
        grade or below.
        PDW = Percentage of Difficult Words(Words not in List(3000 words))
        ASL = Average Sentence Length in words
        If (PDW) is greater than 5%, then:
        Adjusted Score = Raw Score + 3.6365, otherwise Adjusted Score = Raw
        Score

      • typeTokenRatio

        public double typeTokenRatio()
        Calculates Type-Token Ratio
        Formula:
        Token = text length in words
        Type = number of different words
        result = Type/Token
        Returns:
        Type-Token Ratio

      • avgWordFrequencyClass

        public double avgWordFrequencyClass()
        Calculates Average Word Frequency Class
        Formula:
        "Let C be a text corpus, and let |C| be the number of words in C.
        Moreover, let f(w) denote the frequency of a word w âˆˆ C, and let r(w)
        denote the rank of w in a word list of C, which is sorted by decreasing
        frequency. In accordance with [17] we define the word frequency class
        c(w) of a word w âˆˆ C as log2 (f(w âˆ— )/f(w)), where w âˆ— denotes the most
        frequently used word in C"-.
         Plagiarism Detection without Reference Collections
        -
        Sven Meyer zuEissen, Benno Stein, and Marion Kulig
        Returns:
        Average Word Frequency Class

      • compressionRate

        public double compressionRate()
                       throws java.io.IOException
        Measures the Compression Rate(1.0 = 100%) Compression Tool = "ZIP" with Level 9 (Highest)
        NOT WORKING CORRECTLY WITH A STRING ENTERED.
        WORKS FINE WITH A FILEPATH.
        Returns:
        the compression rate e.g. 10 MB compresses into 9MB
        then 0.1(10%) will be returned
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException

      • compressionTime

        public double compressionTime(int rounds)
                       throws java.lang.Exception
        Calculates the compression in MegaBytes/Sec
        Parameters:
        rounds - - number of times the algorithm runs
        more rounds -> better result
        Returns:
        how many MegaBytes/Sec compress
        Throws:
        java.lang.Exception - - When File is too small, the time to compress cannot be measured
